tool_description: Tweets and other data of politicians. Get tweets made Senators, Governors and the sentimental analysis score using NLP. find out the most liked tweet of a specific Representative. Get also summary by political parties.
name: Ponalytics
title: Ponalytics

api_list.name: Political party summary by party
api_list.description: Returns the summary of a specific political party. By default during the last extraction date. Provides Sentimental analysis and score mean.  For example, for the Democratic party it would be "/partytweets/D"
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://ponalytics.p.rapidapi.com/partytweets/I"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "ponalytics.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://ponalytics.p.rapidapi.com/partytweets/{party}"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "ponalytics.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Get political party summary

api_list.name: Get tweets summary
api_list.description: Get the summary of all tweets for each extraction date. Here is possible to find. Most liked tweets, most retweeted tweets, sentiment analysis score created using NLP AI and word frequency among others. By default during the last extraction of all active accounts. IMPORTANT! This would bring more that 500 records.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://ponalytics.p.rapidapi.com/summarytweets"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "ponalytics.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
